main event: On January 24, 1950, a C-45 aircraft crew observed an unidentified flying object while flying from Pope Air Force Base to Bolling Air Force Base.
interesting points: The object was approximately 200-250 ft. in diameter and appeared hemispherical or spheroid in shape., The object moved smoothly and was never overtaken by the C-45, indicating high speed capabilities., The pilots described a black smoke trail behind the object, which was three to four times longer than the object itself., The sighting lasted about 15 minutes, and the object was visible at distances ranging from 5 to 10 miles., All witnesses insisted the object was not a cloud, meteor, or conventional aircraft.
sighted object: an unidentified hemispherical or spheroid object with a black smoke trail
location: Between Pope AFB and Bolling Fld, Virginia, USA
witness description: Captain G. B. Edwards (pilot), Captain Thuron C. Fehrenach (co-pilot), and 1st Lt. John H. Van Santen (passenger)
